explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is -2.8degC (c.c.) (ICSC, 2004) and the boiling point is 80.5degC, which is classified into Category 2. Those containing stabilizers are classified into Class 3 and Packing Group II (UN#1919) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though containing unsaturated bonds. Those containing stabilizers are classified into Class 3 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#1919)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 468degC (ICSC, 2004)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: No data available. Those containing stabilizers are classified into Class 3 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#1919)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 277 mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 277mg/kg, 300mg/kg and 765mg/kg (ECETOC JACC37 (1998)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) of 1,250 mg/kg (ECETOC JACC 37, 1998)

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (4 hours) value of 1,200ppm, calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (inhalation of vapour) of 3.58mg/L, 5.7mg/L, 6.5mg/L and 4.83mg/L (ECETOC JACC 37 (1998)), was lower than 90% of the saturated vapor concentration (114,000ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 86.6mmHg (25degC) (equivalent to 11,500Pa at 25degC) (HSDB (2005)), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of rabbit primary skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 98-10 (1999)) (necrosis is observed) and lack of data for subclassification, although the substance should be placed in Category 1A from the viewpoint of safety.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the guidelines: Substances should be classified into Category 1 if the results of reliable exposure tests suggest that they are corrosive to human or animal skin. Originally classified into Category 2, based on the description in CERI Hazard Data 98-10 (1999) (extremely irritating to rabbit eyes) and ECETOC JACC No. 37 (1998) (severely irritating to the eyes).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Category 1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: Based on the classification by the Japan Society for Occupational Health and the Japanese Society of Occupational Allergy (Skin Sensitizing Substances).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, positive data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests) (intraperitoneal administration) and the absence of data on germ cell genotoxicity tests in vivo, described in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.98-10 (1999).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Group 3 by IARC (1999), Category A4 by ACGIH (2005) and Group D by EPA (1990).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (central nervous system) Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on human evidence including "coma, convulsions" (CERI Hazard Data 98-10 (1999)), and the description in MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003): "Tearing properties are observed and the vapor irritates the eye, respiratory tract and skin."

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "olfactory atrophy, lack of the columnar cell layer associated with hyperplasia of stratified basal cells," "an increase in the relative weight of the kidneys, an increase in the incidence of renal disease" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003)). The effects on experimental animals are observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1 (Respiratory Organs) and Category 2 (Kidneys).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 96 hours LC50=1.1mg/L of the fish (Sheepshead Minnow) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (preliminary version), 2006).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by TOC: 100%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=0.8(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.
